Build a raised bed: Create a raised bed using wood, stone, or concrete blocks to provide a soil-free growing space. This will allow you to plant your garden without worrying about the hard ground. You can add a liner to the bottom of the raised bed to prevent soil from seeping in and to make it easier to maintain.

Use a greenhouse: If the ground is too hard to dig into, consider building a greenhouse to grow your plants. A greenhouse provides a controlled environment that allows you to grow plants year-round, regardless of the weather conditions outside. You can use a prefabricated greenhouse kit or build one from scratch.

Hydroponics: Hydroponics is a method of growing plants without soil. Instead, the plants are grown in a nutrient-rich solution that is circulated through a system of pipes and pumps. This method can be used indoors or outdoors, making it ideal for areas with hard ground. You can set up a hydroponic system in a small space, such as a balcony or patio, and grow a variety of plants.

Vertical gardening: If the ground is too hard to dig into, consider using a vertical gardening system. This involves growing plants up a wall or trellis, using a system of hooks, brackets, or pockets to support the plants. This method can be used to grow a variety of plants, including herbs, vegetables, and flowers.

Geodesic dome greenhouse: A geodesic dome greenhouse is a unique and creative way to grow plants in a hard-to-reach area. The dome shape provides maximum growing space while minimizing the amount of materials needed. The dome can be made from a variety of materials, including plastic, metal, or even recycled materials. This method can be used to grow a variety of plants, including vegetables, fruits, and flowers.
